paper_abstract: In this paper we explore a connection between two seemingly different problems from two different domains: the small-set expansion problem studied in unique games conjecture, and a popular community finding approach for social networks known as the modularity clustering approach. We show that a sub-exponential time algorithm for the small-set expansion problem leads to a sub-exponential time constant factor approximation for some hard input instances of the modularity clustering problem. (C) 2014 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: On a connection between small set expansions and modularity clustering
